msIdentifier.idno: Marion County Circuit Court Case Files No 7391

div1.p: In the matter of the Habeas Corpus proceedings for Mollie A. Calhoun
No. 7931. Dept. 2.
Register No. 7931
In the Circuit Court OF THE STATE OF OREGON For the County of Marion
DEPARTMENT No. 2
In the matter of the Habeas Corpus Proceedings for Mollie A Calhoun
Plaintiff... vs Defendant
Petition for Writ of Habeas Cor
Filed this 23 day of March 189 1903
John W. Roland Clerk. by C. Roland Deputy.
Richardson D'ARCY & RICHARDSON, Attorneys for Petitioner
Residence and Post Office Address, Salem, Oregon.
In the Circuit Court of the State of Oregon for Marion County Department number Two.
In the matter of the application for a writ of habeas corpus for Mollie A. Calhoun, a minor.
Comes now Frank Smith and respectfully petitions Hon. R.P.Boise, Judge of the above entitled Court and shows the following facts, towit:-

That the above named Mollie A. Calhoun is a minor of the age fourteen years. That Joseph Calhoun is her father and that he is now and for some time past is and has been at Salisaw, Indian Territory. That said Joseph Calhoun on or about September 1902 entrusted your pettitioner with the care, custody, charge and control of said Mollie A. Calhoun and that your petitioner ever since has been and is now entitled to the care, charge, custody and control of said Mollie A. Calhoun. That your petioner petitioner heretofore had an agreement with W.E.Miller and Mrs. W.E. Miller that they would take said Mollie A. Calhoun to their home in Salem, Oregon, and would treat her kindly, clothe her, properly care for her and send her to school. That said parties have not treated her kindly nor properly cared for her nor sent her to school, but they are overworking her and requiring her to work all the time without any compensation and making a slave out of her. That said parties are not suitable persons to keep said Mollie A. Calhoun. That said Mrs.W.E.Miller has threatened said Mollie A. Calhoun that she would kill her if she did not do as she was ordered to do. That said Mrs.S.E.Miller will not permit your petitioner to talk to said Mollie A.Calhoun, except in said Miller's presence and hearing. That your petitioner on March 23, 1903, demanded possession of said Mollie A.Calhoun but said Mrs.S.C.Miller refuses to deliver her up to your petitioner
Page 1.
Petition.

although your petitioner has personaly and duly demanded such possession. That your petitioner is the next friend of said Mollie A.Calhoun and that your petitioner made such demand for her possession under and by virtue of the authority and direction and request of her said father Joseph Calhoun. That said W.E.Miller and Mrs.W.E.Miller are now wrongfully and unlawfully imprisoning and restraining said Mollie A.Calhoun of her liberty at Salem in Marion County,Oregon, and that said Mollie A.Calhoun is not imprisoned or restrained by virtue of any order, judgment, decree, or other officer of the United States, or by virtue of the judgment, order, process, or decree of any competent tribunal of civil or criminal jurisdiction or by virtue of an execution issued upon such judgment or decree. That said W.E.Miller and Mrs W.E. Miller have no reason, cause or pretense for the detaining, imprisoning or restraining said Mollie A.Calhoun. That said detaining, imprisoning or restraining of said Mollie A.Calhoun has not been already adjudged, upon a prior writ of habeas corpus, to the knowledge or belief of your petioner petitioner.

Wherefore your petitioner prays an order that a writ of habeas corpus be issued directed to said W.E.Moller and Mrs. W.E. Miller commanding them and each of them to bring and have the body of said Mollie A.Calhoun before your Honor at a time therein specified to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning her thee the said Mollie A. Calhoun together with the time and cause of her detention, and said writ; that she may be restored to her liberty and the custody of your petitioner.
Frank Smith Petitioner.
Page 2.
Petition.
State of Oregon, County of Marion ss.
I, Frank Smith being first duly sworn, say that I am Petitioner in the within entitled cause; and that the foregoing Petition therein is true as I verily believe
Subscribed and sworn to before me, this 23 day of March A. D. 1903 ST Richardson Notary Public for Oregon.
State of Oregon, County of ss.

I, do herby certify that I am one of the Attorneys for in the within entitled cause; that I have prepared the foregoing copy of and have carefully compared the same with the original therefore, and that it is a true and correct transcript therefrom and of the whole thereof.
One of the Attorneys for
State of Oregon, County of ss.

I, do hereby accept due and legal service of the within in County, Oregon, on this day of 189, by receiving a true copy thereof duly certified to be such by one of the Attorneys for I further certify that I am a resident and inhabitant of the said County, and I am one of the Attorneys of record for the
One of the Attorneys for
Reg No 7931
In the Circuit Court of Marion Co Oregon Dept No 2
In the matter of the application for a writ of Habeas Corpus for Mollie A. Calhoun
Order for a writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed March 23 1903
John W. Roland- Clerk
By C. Roland- Deputy
Richardson & Richardson Attys for Petitioner
In the Circuit Court of the State of Oregon for Marion County x Dept no 2
In the matter of the application for a writ of habeas Corpus for Mollie A Calhoun a minor

Based upon the petition of Frank Smith whereby in appears that Mollie A Calhoun a minor is unlawfully imprisoned restrained of her liberty by W.E. Miller and Mrs WE Miller in Salem, in Marion County, Oregon, and stating wherein said illegality exists.

It is ordered that a writ of habeas Corpus issue out of and under the Seal of the above entitled Court directed to WE Miller Commanding them and Each of them to have the body of said Mollie A Calhoun before us in the Court Room of the said Court on the 24 day of 19 March 1903 at 2 oclock P.M. of said day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered
concerning the said Mollie A. Calhoun to together with the time and Cause of her detention and that they have then and there the said writ
Dated this 23 day of March 1903
In the Court, OF THE STATE OF OREGON. For the County of
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.

In the Matter of the Application of
for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed Mar 24 1803
John W. Roland County Clerk.
By Deputy.
In the Circuit Court, of the State of Oregon, FOR THE COUNTY OF Marion
In the Matter of the Application of for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Mollie A. Calhoun a minor for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
In the Name of the State of Oregon: To W.E. Miller and Mrs W.E. Miller

GREETING: We command you that you have and produce the body of Molli A. Calhoun by your imprisoned and restrained, as it is said by whatsoever name said Molli A. Calhoun shall be called or charged, and certify and return therewith the time and cause of imprisonment or restraint, before Hon R. P. Boise Judge of the Circuit Court of the State of Oregon, for Marion County of Marion on the 24 day of March A. D. 18 1903 at 2 o'clock in the P.M. noon of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered the said Molli A. Calhoun And have you then and there this Writ.
WITNESS, Hon. R.P. Boise Judge of the said Circuit Court of the State of Oregon, for the County of Marion this 23 day of March A. D. 1903
ATTEST my hand and the seal of said Court, the day and year last above written.
John W. Roland Clerk.
By C. Roland Deputy.
State of Oregon, County of Marion ss.

I hereby certify that I served the enclosed application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus by delivering the Original thereof to W.E. Miller and Mrs W.E. Miller & Each of them in person and personally, Dated at Salem this 23 day of March 1903
B.B. Colbach Sheriff of Marion Co
In the matter of the application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Mollie A. Calhoun a minor now on this day this cause

Came on before this Court at 2 oclock PM of March 24, 1903, petitioner appearing by Richardson & Richardson his attorneys and W. E. Miller and Mrs W. E. Miller in person as well as by their attorney C. E. Lennon and upon motion of petitioner this proceeding was ordered dismissed
